faq.question: Do I need a permit to visit Spiti Valley?
faq.answer: Indian nationals do not need a permit. Foreigners require a Protected Area Permit for certain areas.

faq.question: What is the best time to visit Spiti Valley?
faq.answer: The best time is June to September when roads are open and weather is pleasant.

faq.question: How to prevent altitude sickness in Spiti?
faq.answer: Acclimatize for a day in Kaza, stay hydrated, and avoid strenuous activity on arrival.

faq.question: Are ATMs available in Spiti Valley?
faq.answer: ATMs are available in Kaza, but carry cash for remote areas.

faq.question: Which mobile networks work in Spiti Valley?
faq.answer: BSNL has the widest coverage, but expect limited or no signal in many villages.

faq.question: Are roads to Spiti open year-round?
faq.answer: No, the Manali-Kaza road is open June–October; Shimla-Kaza route is open most of the year, weather permitting.

faq.question: How cold does it get in Spiti?
faq.answer: Nights can be freezing even in summer; winters are extremely cold with heavy snowfall.

faq.question: Is vegetarian food available in Spiti?
faq.answer: Yes, most hotels and cafes offer vegetarian options.

faq.question: Are fuel stations available in Spiti?
faq.answer: Fuel is available in Kaza; fill up before heading to remote areas.

faq.question: What health precautions should I take?
faq.answer: Carry basic medicines, sunscreen, and consult a doctor if you have health issues.

transport.description: Shimla-Kaza road is open most of the year, passing through Reckong Peo and Nako.
Manali-Kaza road (200 km) is open June–October; crosses Rohtang and Kunzum Pass.
Kaza Bus Stand connects to Manali, Shimla, and local villages.
Taxis available in Kaza for sightseeing and inter-village travel.
Bike rentals available in Kaza for local and long-distance trips.
Permits for foreigners issued at Reckong Peo or Kaza SDM Office.
Shared cabs and jeeps available for local transport between villages.
Kaza to Tabo (48 km, 1.5 hours) by taxi or bus.
Kaza to Pin Valley (35 km, 1 hour) by taxi or shared jeep.
Nearest airport is Bhuntar (Kullu), 250 km from Kaza.
